com.indooratlas.android

Interface IndoorAtlasListener


  • public interface IndoorAtlasListener
    IndoorAtlasListener is the public callback interface of IndoorAtlas API.
    Since:
    0.5
    Version:
    0.5

    • Method Detail

      • onServiceUpdate

        void onServiceUpdate(ServiceState state)
        Notifies about a new position estimate from the IndoorAtlas service. The position of the device is available in alternative coordinate systems through the state parameter. The heading of the device is available in both radians and degrees.

        Calls on onServiceUpdate start occurring periodically immediately after startPositioning in interface IndoorAtlas has been successfully completed, indicated through a notify call on onServiceInitialized.

        For more information, see ServiceState.
        Parameters:
        state - the new position of the device

      • onServiceFailure

        void onServiceFailure(int errorCode,
                    java.lang.String reason)
        Notifies about a failure related to communication with IndoorAtlas.
        Parameters:
        errorCode - error code
        reason - a human readable description of the cause of the failure

      • onServiceInitializing

        void onServiceInitializing()
        Notifies that initialization of a new positioning session was started.

      • onCalibrationFailed

        void onCalibrationFailed(java.lang.String reason)
        Notifies about a failure in calibrating the device.
        Parameters:

      • onCalibrationStatus

        void onCalibrationStatus(CalibrationState calibrationState)
        Notifies about calibration status. If calibrationState.getPercentage() suddenly drops down to 0, then it means that the current calibration attempt has failed. In this case the calibration is immediately restarted without calling onCalibrationFailed(). If calibration is restarted, then it means that you are probably moving the device too quickly during the calibration. The lower the quality of the sensors in the device, the slower the calibration movements must be.

      • onNetworkChangeComplete

        void onNetworkChangeComplete(boolean success)
        Notifies about network preference result.
        Parameters:
        success - true if the operation succeeded. In the case the hipri tear down does not succeed, failure is reported after a few retries.
